  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND A PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR WITH ONE SIDE WET. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDER METHODS THE PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED.

item.title: Report E-2025030237
item.description:
Report E-2025030237

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: FLETCHER
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When our driver hooked up to the customer fill line and recognized when that the connection of the adapter fitting didn't feel snug enough (we teach drivers to do the twist test) so he used shims and that helped tigthen up the connection but when he started unloading product began spraying out. By the time he shut down and the pressure relieved 1 gallon was lost amongst his bucket, spill pads and the ground which the customer helped clean up. Additional shims and double gaskets weren't enough to overcome the problem. After going through the troubleshooting we were able to deduce that the camlock arms on the fitting were bad and was going to need to be replaced altogether to make delivery.
